title: trying to add login, email, imap and pop but getting login failed - need help - was working broke now
content:
Spectrum said call Mozilla for support. They said call Mozilla.

Thunderbird on my old pc was working fine for a month. Had Microsoft on the line and they deleted my email account and added it again and Thunderbird can no longer connect to spectrum mail service. I tried to fix it and had it working going out(sending) but not receiving for a couple of hours but then started over and broke it permanently with login error from server and could not fix it after I screwed it up. So here I am.

Also, have new second pc and just loaded thunderbird and it gets same login problem. Also had Microsoft look at my new pc which has classic office home 2024 and m365 office 2024 but they could not get either one of them to work connecting to spectrum and get same login error. MS tried used my old pc because it was actually working and they added same setup there and they could not get it working.

Gmail works fine on all these programs mentioned above. Just talking to spectrum gets failed logon error which configuration, email name or password are wrong.

I am doing something wrong and cannot find the problem.

Can you help?
creator: fliuzzi1

title: Messages deleted/missing after compacting
content:
Several days ago, I asked for an explanation of any process that would retrieve the emails I lost (completely missing) after the compacting process. (You are referring to https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1513163 )

Your information indicates that compacting would not cause any data loss. That has not been the case.

To date, I further haven't received any response regarding how I might retrieve those emails.

Many of these emails are quite important to my business - and I entrusted your software to preserve those. Again - no response regarding how I might retrieve them.

Please respond ASAP - I am at critical juncture here, and need a resolution forthwith.

Thank you. John Van Epps <redacted>@gmail.com

title: Impostazioni e accesso PEC anomale
content:
Buongiorno, ho un grosso problema con l'invio e ricevimento dei messaggi pec sulle due caselle che illustrerò di seguito. Qualche giorno fa, dopo aver cambiato la PSW ad entrambe ho cominciato a riuscontrare problemi con le due PEC. Praticamente non vedo più gli account. Se fino a ieri dopo un tentato invio o ricezione mi compariva il messaggio di PSW errata, dopo averle ricambiate entrambe mi sono praticamente spariti gli account in Thunderbird. Tutto è comunque dettagliatamente spiegato nel PDF allegato. Ho provato in contuinuazione a modificare gli account incriminati ma senza nessun risultato. Ho pensato quindi di cancellarli e riecreali ma ho paura di perdere tutta la posta precedente. Grazie per l'aiuto.


Casella Email "nomeutente"@pec.it e direzione@pec."dominio".it
creator: comelca

title: componente aggiuntivo ImportExportTool NG e ImportExportTool per versione Thunderbird 139.0
content: Buongiorno, Ho molte Unità sulle quali è installato ThunderBird versione 139.0, aggiornamento proposto dalla stessa piattaforma durante l'utilizzo, che ha impedito l'installazione del componente aggiuntivo ImportExportTool, in quanto non risulta presente per la versione 139.0 di Thunderbird. Ho necessità di avere tale componente per trasferimento mail aziendali dal vecchio provider, ma ho visto che ad oggi c'è la versione Beta per la 138, allora perchè viene proposta la versione 139 se non ci sono i relativi componenti?? Se l'assistenza legge questo forum "Vi prego lanciate la componente compatibile, altrimenti sarò costretto mio malgrado a cambiare provider per la gestione mail. Qualcuno ha soluzioni o componenti da suggerirmi in alternativa?? Grazie e Buon lavoro a tutti
creator: dariod737

title: Overstap ESR naar Release kanaal
content: Beste, ik heb met succes mijn Thunderbird ESR (32 bit) naar Release kanaal omgezet. Mijn installatie map was en is nog steeds C:\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Thunderbird. Als ik de versie opvraag in Thunderbird dan staat er nu "64 bit". Heb ik nu effectief de 64 bit versie maar in de map van de 32 bit programma's? In de map C:\Program Files\Mozilla Thunderbird staat nog een oude installatie. Hoe kan ik die verwijderen op een veilige manier zonder de actieve installatie te beschadigen? Moet de actieve installatie niet getransfereerd worden naar de map Program Files? Het is een beetje verwarrend allemaal. Mvg, Bert Caus
creator: bert33

title: Upgraded to Release channel v139.0 but new email Notifications come from ESR

title: Profile networking/synching
content: I run a small network using a synology NAS. I have Thunderbird as an email client on each of my lap top and a desktop which mainly serves as a backup and when I need more power. Consequently Thunderbird on the desktop does not often get used and falls annoyingly out of date because the respective profile folders are stored on the local machines. I do not want to store the profile folder on the synology NAS because this would make thunderbird unusable if I am away from the LAN. (out of curiosity would this work anyway)? I do not want to make the NAS directly accessible from the internet. Would it be possible to synch each profile folder, ie laptop/profile and desktop/profile to a profile folder on the synology drive ie synology/profile such that the profile folders will all synch when any one of them is connected to the NAS? Thank you for the help.
creator: Paul-Kemp

title: It would be very useful if I could list Inbox and Sent mail together, without including any other folders.
content:
It would be very useful if I could see Inbox and Sent mail together, in a single list, without including any other folders.

If I use All Mail, it includes all of my archived emails as well. I would like to avoid this when I go through all of my Inbox and Sent emails and put the ones I want to keep into archive folders.

I suppose a simpler and more flexible way to implement this would be to provide the ability to use check boxes to select exactly which folders I want to include in the list. Each folder would have a its own check box. That would be very flexible and incredibly useful.
creator: muh

title: Kubuntu/snap: Thunderbird moved after update / profile and mails gone
content:
Hello, I am using Kubuntu 24.04.2 LTS on a Lenovo T470. After a regular installation of updates via Discover three days ago, thunderbird can no longer be started via the icon in the window bar (message: KDE -Plasma workspace: The file or folder /snap/thunderbird/644/usr/lib/thunderbird/thunderbird-bin does not exist).

I was able to start thunderbird via the menu (the location now appears to be /snap/bin/thunderbird), but the profile and all mails have disappeared, as if I had reinstalled thunderbird.

The Personal folder/snap/thunderbird folder contains the folders 721, 734, common and current. Only common has something, but very little content (25 MB).

I set up my profile again in the post-update thunderbird (no problem thanks to imap-server), which works well. However, now I have two icons: If I click icon no 1, thunderbird starts as a new installation without any profile and mails, icon 2, thunderbird starts with my profile.

Can anyone make sense of this strange behavior?
creator: schiek
